etymology.interpretation: The word 锣鼓(鑼鼓) (luógǔ) refers to the combination of the gong and drum, which are commonly used together in traditional Chinese music, particularly in festivals and celebrations. The pairing of these two instruments creates a lively and rhythmic sound, integral to various cultural performances and ceremonies.

examples.chinese: 节日庆典时(節日慶典時)，锣鼓喧天(鑼鼓喧天)。
examples.pinyin: Jié rì qìng diǎn shí, luó gǔ xuān tiān.
examples.english: During the festive celebration, the gongs and drums resound.

examples.chinese: 婚礼进行时(婚禮進行時)，锣鼓齐奏响乐章(鑼鼓齊奏響樂章)。
examples.pinyin: Hūn lǐ jìn xíng shí, luó gǔ qí zòu xiǎng yuè zhāng.
examples.english: During the wedding, the gongs and drums play in unison, echoing a joyful tune.

examples.chinese: 街头巷尾响起锣鼓(街頭巷尾響起鑼鼓)，庆祝新年的到来(慶祝新年的到來)。
examples.pinyin: Jiē tóu xiàng wěi xiǎng qǐ luó gǔ, qìng zhù xīn nián de dào lái.
examples.english: Throughout the streets and alleys, the gongs and drums resound to celebrate the arrival of the New Year.
